com.yantra.api.ycd

Interface getReturnPolicy

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.YCDApi, YIFApi

    public interface getReturnPolicy

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document getReturnPolicy(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The getReturnPolicy API is basically an API which determines the Return Policy of each and every Order Line that is passed as the input to this API.

    • Method Detail

      • getReturnPolicy

        org.w3c.dom.Document getReturnPolicy(YFSEnvironment env,
                                     org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                              throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                     java.rmi.RemoteException
        The getReturnPolicy API is basically an API which determines the Return Policy of each and every Order Line that is passed as the input to this API. This api will take in a list of lines which will be included on a return order. Most of these lines will be from some sales order so the order header key passed on the line will be of the original sales order not the return. There will also be some lines which do not have an originating sales order (blind lines). These lines will not have a header key or a line key. In order to determine the return policy for the blind lines the item details are required. The ItemID, UnitOfMeasure and ProductClass combination is mandatory. The first thing we need to do is loop across the lines on the order and build the input xmls for the getCompleteItemList and getCompleteOrderDetails. We should be smart and keep track of the order header keys on each line so that we don't get the order information for every line when in the scenarios where most of the lines are on the same order. We are using the api instead of going directly to the DB for the order information so that the customers can specify the template that we use when passing information to the UE. We will by default be passing the following information into the UE so that the customer can use this information for calculating thresholds: order dates, the standard header information, standard line information, standard item information, and User ID. The input XML has a required attribute at the root level for the enterpriseCode. This is required mainly for blind lines since they will not have an original sales order to associate to. This information is needed to identify the item to pass to the UE to determine the return policy for the item. If user exit is implemented and extension attributes are included in input template of the user exit, these attributes are fetched and passed in the input to user exit. If extension attributes are passed as input to the api, it is passed on to the user exit. If value passed in api input differ from the value fetched, precedence goes to the value in api input and that is passed in the input to user exit.
      • Call the user exit YCDGetReturnPolicyUE to allow other implementation specific rules to be checked.

      Related Documents
      Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

      User Exits:

        com.yantra.pca.ycd.japi.ue.YCDGetReturnPolicyUE
          This user exit is called for after the final output is achieved. The user can override the attributes on the order line to add additional handling that may be required for determining the return method. The default implementation of this user exit is not provided. The error code YCD00042 is thrown if an exception occurs during the invocation of this user exit.

        Events Raised: None

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: No

        Additional Information



Parameters:
env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
inXML - Required. Contains attributes of the address that is to be verified. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

Returns:
An XML document that contains the address details as well as a status representing if the verification succeeded, failed, or could not be performed. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
